constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 102 (Wednesday, June 15, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. MOONEY:
H.R. 8082.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 7:
[The Congress shall have Power . . .] To establish Post
Offices and post Roads; . . .
[Page H5611]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 101 West Washington Street in Charles Town, West Virginia, as the "Corporal Frank Buckles Post Office".
